alert.note: Alert for Central Carbon County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 1:09PM MST until January 18 at 3:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow showers. Areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Much of southeast Wyoming, including the Interstate-25 corridor from Cheyenne to Wheatland, and the Interstate-80 corridor from Pine Bluffs to Rawlins. * WHEN...Until 3 PM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions possible. Falling and drifting snow may result in pockets of slick road conditions. Visibilities may be reduced to under one half mile at times.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
